content.description: Climb the 2” crack to the top, almost no crack climbing needed.  The route is just toying with climbers who want to climb the crack.
content.location:
Top Rope wall: At the entrance to the corridor.

Top Rope wall: Red-Toy Crack 5.2, Purple- Think About it 5.6,  Blue - Snow Flake 5.4, Yellow - Groovy Corner 5.6

content.description: Climb the face and midway up use the right facing edge. Finish it off to the top.
content.location:
Top Rope wall: One Foot left of the in cut at the ground, and at a very small vertical seam/crack.

Top Rope wall: Red-Toy Crack 5.2, Purple- Think About it 5.6,  Blue - Snow Flake 5.4, Yellow - Groovy Corner 5.6

content.description: Standing start, Grab the hand hold at the base of the short vertical crack and reach over left to the horizontal in the center of the face, also used for “Reach for It” however it’s with the opposite hand.  Move up straight up the thin face.
content.location:
Left side outcrop: Below the short vertical crack.

Bouldering wall: Yellow- Exit Stage Left V1, Blue- Reach for It V1, Purple- Sticky Stinky Feet V2, Orange Descent V0

content.description: Step up on the right side of the in cut at the ground level, climb the face to the flake and follow it to the top.
content.location:
Top Rope wall: Three feet left of the tree at the base.

Top Rope wall: Red-Toy Crack 5.2, Purple- Think About it 5.6,  Blue - Snow Flake 5.4, Yellow - Groovy Corner 5.6

content.description: Sit start on two opposing, side-pull crimps and work to match hands on the large rail. Using the aretes and a great heel hook, move to the good hold on the right arete, about a foot below the lip, and top out.
content.location: Riot Time is above the left side outcrop; you can see the left side outcrop from the base of Riot Time.

content.description: Standing start, Move up and slightly left to a small horizontal in the center of the face, continue straight up to the top of the shelf.
content.location:
Left side outcrop: Start right in front of the chest high Diamond shaped rock.

Bouldering wall: Yellow- Exit Stage Left V1, Blue- Reach for It V1, Purple- Sticky Stinky Feet V2, Orange Descent V0

content.description: An indirect and harder start to “Exit Stage Left” Sit Start below the chest high Diamond shape feature, Move up and slightly left before reaching for the left facing sloper hold on “Exit Stage Left”.  A long Pop Up move will give you access to the top edge, followed by easy moves to the shelf.John Brunson - Pop Up - YouTube Video
content.location: Left side outcrop: Start right in front of the chest high Diamond shaped rock.

content.description: Climb the face without using the left edge of the main rock or the crack of “Toy Crack” don’t fall off and hit your head on the wall behind you.
content.location:
Top Rope wall: deep in the corridor just right of the end of the main rock face.              

Deep in the corridor, Creepy Shadows 5.6 and also Headie 5.7

content.description: Follow the 6” to 3” deep right facing corner grove to the top.  While avoiding the flake to the left that is used for the climb “Snow Flake”
content.location:
Top Rope wall: Directly at the base of the tree.

Top Rope wall: Red-Toy Crack 5.2, Purple- Think About it 5.6,  Blue - Snow Flake 5.4, Yellow - Groovy Corner 5.6

content.description: Standing start, Tricky moves establishes you into a layback on the short right leaning and left facing sloper hold.  A long reach up will give you access to the top edge, followed by easy moves to the shelf.
content.location:
Left side outcrop: 2 Feet Right of The left edge of the main face.

Bouldering wall: Yellow- Exit Stage Left V1, Blue- Reach for It V1, Purple- Sticky Stinky Feet V2, Orange Descent V0

content.description: This is the primary way to down climb off the shelf.  Note the pocket in the top of the shelf, and stepping down on the lower ramps to the right, moving closer to the Top rope wall.
content.location:
Left side outcrop: 1/3 the distance from the right end.

Bouldering wall: Yellow- Exit Stage Left V1, Blue- Reach for It V1, Purple- Sticky Stinky Feet V2, Orange Descent V0

content.description: Climb the face using the left edge of the main rock.
content.location:
Top Rope wall: deep in the corridor just right of the end of the main rock face.              

Deep in the corridor, Creepy Shadows 5.6 and also Headie 5.7

content.description: Gorsuch switch stands 24 feet tall and has a great gritty texture.  It offers a small collection of both bouldering and easy top rope climbs.  The taller top-rope wall on the right is low angle and offers six distinct lines with numerous variations mostly under 5.7.  The left wall is quite steep and broken by a wide shelf 14 feet up offering some easy to moderate bouldering ending at the shelf.  Higher on the right end is a 30 degree overhanging face offering a few boulder problems, including the area classic Riot Time V5.  I started climbing here and around 2009, and it’s likely others have played here prior.  It’s a small local favorite that can occupy you for a few hours.
